decks.notes: The key focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a resilient and aggressive strategy. It utilizes a combination of powerful creatures such as Questing Beast, Wicked Wolf, and Savvy Hunter to put constant pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes a significant amount of card advantage through Once Upon a Time and Garruk, Cursed Huntsman, allowing for consistent board presence. Additionally, the inclusion of Vraska, Golgari Queen and Murderous Rider provides removal and disruption options. The deck also prioritizes mana ramp with Incubation Druid and Gilded Goose for efficient deck acceleration.

This deck focuses on building a fast and aggressive board presence using low-cost creatures and efficient removal spells. The key strategy is to apply pressure early with creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Gutterbones, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with creatures like Murderous Rider and Rankle, Master of Pranks. Utilizing the abilities of Ayara, First of Locthwain and Priest of Forgotten Gods, the deck aims to maintain card advantage and generate additional value. Castle Locthwain provides additional card draw to ensure a steady stream of threats.

The main idea of this Sultai Aggro deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence using efficient creatures like Wicked Wolf and Savvy Hunter, while also disrupting your opponent's strategy with removal spells like Murderous Rider. The deck also aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Paradise Druid and Gilded Goose in order to cast powerful threats like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Hydroid Krasis. Overall, the key focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful spells.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain a strong aggressive strategy with a focus on using powerful creatures such as Oko, Thief of Crowns, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Hydroid Krasis. The deck also includes cards for control and removal like Time Wipe, Glass Casket, and Deputy of Detention to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of creatures that generate tokens and provide card advantage like Hero of Precinct One and Elite Guardmage, this Bant Aggro deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and maintain board presence while disrupting their strategy.

This deck focuses on ramping up quickly with cards like Paradise Druid and Gilded Goose, allowing you to play powerful creatures like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Oko, Thief of Crowns early in the game. The Great Henge provides card draw and additional mana ramp, while Hydroid Krasis gives you a big threat that can also gain you life. Feasting Troll King and Lovestruck Beast provide additional aggression, making this deck a fast-paced, aggressive Simic aggro deck that aims to overwhelm your opponent with big creatures and constant pressure.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana with mana dorks like Gilded Goose and Leafkin Druid, while also utilizing the powerful planeswalkers Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Oko, Thief of Crowns to generate value and disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck aims to play threats like Hydroid Krasis, Voracious Hydra, and Questing Beast to pressure the opponent and close out the game quickly. The inclusion of Brazen Borrower and Wicked Wolf provides additional tempo and removal options, while the mana base ensures consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

This deck relies on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast high-cost spells for free, allowing the player to control the game by playing multiple powerful cards in a single turn. The deck includes powerful control elements such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion to clear the board and protect your life total. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation spells like Drawn from Dreams to ensure you can find the cards you need. The win condition typically involves using Cavalier of Flame to deal massive damage to your opponent while maintaining control of the game.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Zhur-Taa Goblin, Questing Beast, and Gruul Spellbreaker to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Supporting spells like Shock and Collision/Colossus help to remove blockers and push damage through. Domri, Anarch of Bolas provides additional support and card advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient curve of creatures, making it difficult for them to stabilize and mount a defense. The mana base is constructed to consistently provide the necessary colors for casting spells on curve.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Spawn of Mayhem, Questing Beast, and Knight of the Ebon Legion to deal rapid damage to the opponent. Utilizing efficient removal spells like Assassin's Trophy and Murderous Rider, the deck aims to maintain board control while generating card advantage through Midnight Reaper. With a mix of strong creatures and disruption, the Golgari Aggro deck seeks to overwhelm opponents with a relentless assault while maintaining a solid mana base for consistency.

The deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence by utilizing Adventure creatures and taking advantage of the Lucky Clover card to generate extra value. The key strategy is to efficiently play creatures with powerful effects from Adventure cards like Beanstalk Giant and Rimrock Knight, while also maintaining card advantage through the Edgewall Innkeeper. This allows the deck to overwhelm opponents with a mix of aggressive creatures and removal spells like Murderous Rider and Bonecrusher Giant, ultimately aiming to close out the game quickly with a strong board presence.

The main focus of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly cycle through your cards to maintain board presence and deal direct damage to your opponent. By utilizing cards like Improbable Alliance and Irencrag Pyromancer, you can create a steady stream of tokens and burn spells to overwhelm your opponent. Cards like Thrill of Possibility and Opt help you filter through your deck to find key pieces, while powerful creatures like Niv-Mizzet, Parun and Crackling Drake provide additional win conditions. The goal is to outpace your opponent and finish the game quickly with a flurry of spells and attacks.

The focus of this deck is to consistently apply pressure on the opponent with cheap and aggressive creatures like Scorch Spitter, Grim Initiate, Gingerbrute, and Fervent Champion, while also utilizing burn spells like Shock and Chandra's Spitfire to clear the way for damage. Castle Embereth boosts the power of creatures on board, and Torbran, Thane of Red Fell amplifies all the burn and damage effects, making every point of damage count. Light Up the Stage and Chandra, Acolyte of Flame provide card advantage to keep the pressure up and overwhelm the opponent quickly.

The main idea of this deck is to control the board and slow down the opponent's strategy by utilizing powerful control cards like Ritual of Soot, Legion's End, and Murderous Rider. With the help of Fires of Invention, the deck aims to cast powerful spells for free and generate value through cards like Liliana, Dreadhorde General and Agent of Treachery. Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Fae of Wishes provide additional flexibility and options for the player, while Field of the Dead can generate a powerful board presence over time. The deck focuses on controlling the game and out-valuing the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It aims to deal damage early and often, using cards like Spawn of Mayhem, Robber of the Rich, and Knight of the Ebon Legion to apply pressure. It also includes removal spells like Murderous Rider and Shock to control the board. The goal is to maintain a fast pace, utilizing efficient creatures and direct damage to win the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize. Castle Locthwain and Castle Embereth provide additional utility and card advantage in the mid to late game.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures and powerful burn spells. By playing low-cost creatures like Scorch Spitter and Tin Street Dodger alongside efficient removal spells like Shock and Slaying Fire, the deck aims to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. The inclusion of cards like Light Up the Stage and Experimental Frenzy allows the deck to maintain card advantage and continue applying pressure. The deck's reliance on red mana sources and Castle Embereth emphasizes its aggressive playstyle and focus on ending the game quickly.

This Bant Control deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Hydroid Krasis. It aims to control the game with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Time Wipe while using Once Upon a Time to find key pieces. The deck also utilizes Field of the Dead to generate an army of Zombie tokens. By establishing control of the game early and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures, this deck seeks to outlast and outvalue its opponents in Standard 1 vs 1 matches.
